text: Soumaila Sidibe (born June 15, 1992 in Bamako) is a Malian footballer who plays for AS Police de Bamako. He plays primarily as a defensive midfielder. ==Club career== In January 2015, Sidibe signed a three and a half year contract with Algerian Ligue Professionnelle 1 club MO Béjaïa, becoming the first ever foreign player in the history of the club. ==International career== Sidibe was a member of the Mali national under-20 football team at the 2011 FIFA U-20 World Cup in Colombia, where he started all three all of Mali's matches. ==Honours== ;MO Béjaïa * Algerian Cup: 2015 ==References== ==External links== * * * Category:1992 births Category:Mali under-20 international footballers Category:Malian expatriate footballers Category:Malian footballers Category:Living people Category:Algerian Ligue Professionnelle 1 players Category:MO Béjaïa players Category:USM Alger players Category:CO de Bamako players Category:CR Belouizdad players Category:Sportspeople from Bamako Category:Association football midfielders Category:Expatriate footballers in Algeria Category:Malian expatriate sportspeople in Algeria Category:Mali international footballers
title: Soumaila Sidibe
